description: Sequence variants of Escherichia coli elongation factor Tu that confer resistance to Enacyloxin IIa

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsH) mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of the rrsH 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae acrR with mutation conferring multidrug antibiotic resistance
description: AcrR is a repressor of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrR mutations result in high level antibiotic resistance.

name: Klebsiella aerogenes acrR with mutation conferring multidrug antibiotic resistance
description: AcrR is a repressor of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrR mutations result in high level antibiotic resistance.

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrnB) mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of helix 35, in the rrnB gene operon for 16S rRNA of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: Escherichia coli marR mutant conferring antibiotic resistance
description: MarR is a repressor of the mar operon marRAB, thus regulating the expression of marA, the activator of multidrug efflux pump AcrAB.

name: Salmonella enterica ramR mutants
description: RamR is a repressor that regulates RamA expression. Mutations lead to the upregulation of AcrAB, which is positively regulated by RamA.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae ramR mutants
description: RamR is a repressor that regulates RamA expression. Mutations lead to the upregulation of AcrAB, which is positively regulated by RamA.

name: Escherichia coli soxR with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance
description: SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps.

name: Salmonella enterica soxR with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance
description: SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps.

name: Salmonella serovars soxS with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance
description: SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.

name: Klebsiella aerogenes Omp36
description: Mutant forms of the porin Omp36 result in reduced permeability to antibiotics.

name: Escherichia coli folP with mutation conferring resistance to sulfonamides
description: Point mutations in Escherichia coli dihydropteroate synthase folP prevent sulfonamide antibiotics from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring sulfonamide resistance.

name: Streptococcus pyogenes folP with mutation conferring resistance to sulfonamides
description: Point mutations in Streptococcus pyogenes dihydropteroate synthase folP prevent sulfonamide antibiotics from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring sulfonamide resistance.

name: dapsone resistant dihydropteroate synthase folP
description: Dapsone inhibits bacterial synthesis of dihydrofolic acid by competing with with para-aminobenzoate for the active site of dihydropteroate synthetase. Thus acts as a competitive inhibitor of folP. Point mutation within the folP gene results in lowered affinity of dapsone for folP

name: Mycobacterium leprae folP with mutation conferring resistance to dapsone
description: Dapsone inhibits bacterial synthesis of dihydrofolic acid by competing with with para-aminobenzoate for the active site of dihydropteroate synthetase. Point mutation within the Mycobacterium leprae folP gene results in lowered affinity of dapsone for folP.

name: Escherichia coli ompF with mutation conferring resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics
description: The Escherichia coli ompF (oprF) is a nonspecific porin channel involved in the membrane translocation of small hydrophilic molecules, including and especially beta-lactam antibiotics. Mutations in ompF can decrease diffusion of antibiotics across the cellular membrane, thereby decreasing overall susceptibility through absence of porin function.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis katG mutations conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: katG is a catalase-peroxidase that catalyzes the activation of isoniazid. Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis, which prevents cell wall synthesis in mycobacteria. Mutations in katG results in inability to activate isoniazid. Over 280 different mutations have been documented in PubMed for katG, with mutations to Ser315 being the most prevalent.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis inhA mutations conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: inhA is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and farry acid biosynthesis. It is inhibited by isoniazid. mutations in the promoter region or multiple copies of the inhA shows marked resistance to isoniazid mediated inhibition of mycolic acid biosynthesis.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis pncA mutations conferring resistance to pyrazinamide
description: pncA is a pyrazinamidase/nicotinamidase. It catalyzes the activation of pyrazinamide. Some mutation within pncA are associated with loss of enzyme activity, resulting in pyrazinamide resistance.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis rpsL mutations conferring resistance to Streptomycin
description:
Ribosomal protein S12 stabilizes the highly conserved
pseudoknot structure formed by 16S rRNA. Amino acid
substitutions in RpsL affect the higher-order structure of 16S
rRNA and confer streptomycin resistance by disrupting interactions between 16S rRNA and streptomycin.

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to gentamicin C
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to gentamicin C

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to G418
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to G418

name: undecaprenyl pyrophosphate related proteins
description: Undecaprenyl phosphate is a universal lipid carrier of glycan biosynthetic intermediates for carbohydrate polymers that are exported to the bacterial cell envelope. Antibiotics that targets this compound or proteins associated with the production of this compound leads to cell death.

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to kanamycin A
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to kanamycin A

name: sulfone antibiotic
description: A sulfone active against a wide range of bacteria but mainly employed for its actions against mycobacterium laprae. Its mechanism of action  involves inhibition of folic acid synthesis in susceptible organisms.

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to neomycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to neomycin

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to paromomycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to paromomycin

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to streptomycin
description: Point mutations in the 5' domain of helix 18, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to streptomycin

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrnB) mutation conferring resistance to streptomycin
description: Point mutations in the 5' domain of helix 18, in the rrnB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to streptomycin

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to tobramycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of the rrnB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to tobramycin

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to tetracycline
description: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to tetracycline

name: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrnB) mutation conferring resistance to tetracycline
description: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of the rrnB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to tetracycline

name: dapsone
description: Dapsone is a sulfone in which it inhibits folic acid synthesis, such as the dihydropteroate synthase.

name: pyrazinamide
description: Pyrazinamide is an Antimycobacterial. It is highly specific and active only against Mycobacterium tuberculosis. This compound is a prodrug and needs to be activated inside the cell. It interferes with the bacterium's ability to synthesize new fatty acids, causing cell death.

name: LFF571
description: LFF571 is a novel semi-synthetic thiopeptide antibiotic derived from GE2270. It has been shown to possess potent in vitro and in vivo activity against Gram-positive bacteria. It is hypothesized that it a translation inhibitor leading to cell death.

name: sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase folP
description: Point mutations in dihydropteroate synthase folP prevent sulfonamide antibiotics from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring sulfonamide resistance

name: isoniazid resistant katG
description: Bifunctional enzyme with both catalase and broad-spectrum peroxidase activity. It is a catalase-peroxidases that catalyzes the activation of isoniazid. Mutations that arises within this protein cause changes that results in the inability for katG to activate antibiotics, conferring resistance

name: antibiotic resistant inhA
description: inhA is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis. It is inhibited by isoniazid. Mutations in the promoter region or multiple copies of the inhA shows marked resistance to isoniazid mediated inhibition of mycolic acid biosynthesis.

name: pyrazinamide resistant pncA
description: pncA is a pyrazinamidase/nicotinamidase. It catalyzes the activation of pyrazinamide to pyrazinoic acid. Mutations arise within the pncA gene that caused the loss of pyrazinamidase activity is the major mechanism of antibiotic resistance

name: antibiotic resistant rpsL
description: Ribosomal protein S12 stabilizes the highly conserved pseudoknot structure formed by 16S rRNA. Amino acid substitutions in RpsL affect the higher-order structure of 16S rRNA and confer antibiotic resistance

name: antibiotic resistant pgsA
description: pgsA or phosphatidylglycerophosphate synthetase is an integral membrane protein involved in phospholipid biosynthesis. It is a CDP-diacylglycerol-glycerol-3-phosphate 3-phosphatidyltransferase.

name: antibiotic resistant mprF
description: Catalyzes the transfer of a lysyl group from L-lysyl-tRNA(Lys) to membrane-bound phosphatidylglycerol (PG), which produces lysylphosphatidylglycerol (LPG), a major component of the bacterial membrane with a positive net charge. LPG synthesis contributes to bacterial virulence as it is involved in the resistance mechanism against cationic antimicrobial peptides (CAMP) produces by the host's immune system (defensins, cathelicidins) and by the competing microorganisms (bacteriocins)

name: antibiotic resistant arabinosyltransferase
description: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabanan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls

name: antibiotic resistant dihydrofolate reductase
description: Key enzyme in folate metabolism. Catalyzes an essential reaction for de novo glycine and purine synthesis, and for DNA precursor synthesis

name: antibiotic sensitive inhA
description: inhA is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis.

name: porin proteins permeable to antibiotics
description: Porin proteins permeable to antibiotics.

name: antibiotic sensitive beta-prime subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoC)
description: RNA polymerase is a multisubunit enzyme that is necessary for transcription. The beta-prime subunit of RNA polymerase forms the active center of the enzyme and template/transcript binding sites. This enzyme can be inactivated by antibiotics leading to cell death.

name: fluoroquinolone sensitive parE
description: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, necessary for cell survival. Point mutations in ParE prevent fluoroquinolones from inhibiting DNA synthesis, thus conferring resistance.

name: antibiotic sensitive Ribosomal protein S12 (rpsL)
description: Ribosomal protein S12 stabilizes the highly conserved pseudoknot structure formed by 16S rRNA. It is targeted and inhibited by streptomycin

name: determinant of isoniazid resistance
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibiotic drug, isoniazid.

name: determinant of pyrazinamide resistance
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibiotic drug pyrazinamide.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to kanamycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' domain of 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium tuberculosis can confer resistance to kanamycin.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to viomycin
description: Peptide antibiotics inhibit protein synthesis. Resistance to viomycin can be caused by an altered RNA molecule in the 16S ribosomal subunit.

name: Enterococcus faecium EF-Tu mutants conferring resistance to GE2270A
description: Sequence variants of Enterococcus faecium elongation factor Tu that confer resistance to GE2270A

name: antibiotic sensitive RNA polymerase switch region
description: The switch region is a structural element that mediates conformational changes and contacts required for RNAP to load DNA into the RNAP active-center cleft during transcription initiation. The switch region is located at the base of the RNAP clamp and serves as the hinge that mediates opening of the RNAP clamp to load DNA into the RNAP active-center cleft and mediates closing of the RNAP clamp to retain DNA in the RNAP active-center cleft.

name: mecB
description: A foreign PBP2 acquired by lateral gene transfer that able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.

name: cfrA
description: CfrA is a chloramphenicol-florfenicol resistance gene and methyltransferase enzyme. Methylation of position 8 of A2503 in 23S rRNA confers resistance to chloramphenicol antibiotics first identified by Schwarz 2000 as cfr from Staphylococcus sciuri. Additional Oxazolidinone resistance mediated by the cfr gene in a human isolated was first reported from Colombia in linezolid- and methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (PMID: 10952608). Described by Arias et al. 2008.  Chandela T. et al. (PMID:  28663118) grouped Cfr with ClbA in the Cfr Group.

name: Antibiotic resistant tlyA
description: tlyA encodes for hemolysin. It Catalyzes the 2'-O-methylation at nucleotides C1409 in 16S rRNA and C1920 in 23S rRNA. Mutation that arise within this gene reduces the binding affinity of aminoglycosides to rRNA

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis tlyA mutations conferring resistance to aminoglycosides
description: Specific mutations that arise in Mycobacterium tuberculosis tlyA resulting in aminoglycosides resistance

name: Antibiotic resistant iniA
description: iniA, an isoniazid-induced protein, is part of the iniBAC operon that participates in the development of tolerance to both isoniazid and ethambutol. May function through a MDR-pump like mechanism, although it does not appear to directly transport isoniazid from the cell

name: Ethambutol resistant iniA
description: Mutations that occurs on the iniA genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniA mutant conferring resistance to Ethambutol
description: Specific mutations in Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniA resulting in resistance to ethambutol

name: Antibiotic resistant iniC
description: iniC, an isoniazid-induced protein, is part of the iniBAC operon that participates in the development of tolerance to both isoniazid and ethambutol. May function through a MDR-pump like mechanism, although it does not appear to directly transport isoniazid from the cell

name: Ethambutol resistant iniC
description: Mutations that occurs on the iniC genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniC mutant conferring resistance to ethambutol
description: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniC causing it to be ethambutol resistant.

name: ethambutol resistant embA
description: Mutations that occurs on the embA genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embA mutant conferring resistance to ethambutol
description: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis embA leading to the lowered affinity of ethambutol to embA

name: ethambutol resistant embR
description: Mutations that occurs on the embR genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embR mutant conferring resistance to ethambutol
description: Point mutation in the M.tuberculosis embR results in increased resistance to ethambutol

name: antibiotic resistant ethA
description: Monooxygenase able to convert a wide range of ketones to the corresponding esters or lactones via a Baeyer-Villiger oxidation reaction. It is responsible for the activation of several thiocarbamide-containing pro-drugs into cytotoxic species

name: ethionamide resistant ethA
description: Mutations that occurs on the ethA genes resulting in the inability to catalyzes the oxidation of ethionamide (ETH) to the corresponding sulfoxide (the active drug)

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis ethA with mutation conferring resistance to ethionamide
description: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis ethA causing it to be ethionamide resistant

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis gyrB mutant conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
description: Point mutation in Mycobacterium tuberculosis gyrB resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance

name: antibiotic resistant ndh
description: ndh is a NADH oxidase. It participates in antibiotic resistance by diminishing NADH oxidation and consequently causes an increase in NADH concentration and depletion of NAD+. This alteration of the NADH/NAD+ ratio prevents the peroxidation reactions required for the activation of INH, as well as the displacement of the NADH-isonicotinic acyl complex from InhA enzyme binding site.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: Point mutations in the Mycobacterium tuberculosis ndh gene shown clinically to confer resistance to isoniazid.

name: antibiotic resistant kasA
description: kasA is a  ketoacyl acyl carrier protein synthase that catalyzes the condensation reaction of fatty acid synthesis by the addition to an acyl acceptor of two carbons from malonyl-ACP. It is involved in elongation of fatty acids intermediate in the biosynthetic pathway of mycolic acids.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis kasA mutant conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: Specific mutations on the Mycobacterium tuberculosis kasA gene resulting in lowered affinity of isoniazid, resulting in resistance

name: rifamycin-resistant arabinosyltransferase
description: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabanan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls and arabinosyltransferases are targets of the drug ethambutol. Mutations in these genes can confer resistance to rifampicin.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embB with mutation conferring resistance to rifampicin
description: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis embB causing it to be rifampicin resistant

name: antibiotic resistant gidB
description: GidB is a m7G methyltransferase specific for 16S rRNA. Mutations within the gidB gene causes changes in the structure or 16s rRNA, leading to resistance to aminoglycosides

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis gidB mutation conferring resistance to streptomycin
description: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis gidB causing it to be streptomycin resistant

name: antibiotic sensitive embR
description: wildtype embR sensitive to antibiotics. It is an arabinosyltransferase involved in lipoarabinomannan synthesis.

name: ethionamide
description: ethionamide is a second-line antitubercular agent that inhibits mycolic acid synthesis

name: antibiotic sensitive ethA
description: ethA is a Monooxygenase that is able to convert a wide range of ketones to the corresponding esters or lactones via a Baeyer-Villiger oxidation reaction. Is responsible for the activation of several thiocarbamide-containing pro-drugs into cytotoxic species.

name: antibiotic sensitive tlyA
description: It Catalyzes the 2'-O-methylation at nucleotides C1409 in 16S rRNA and C1920 in 23S rRNA.

name: antibiotic sensitive gidB
description: GidB is a m7G methyltransferase specific for 16S rRNA.

name: antibiotic sensitive kasA
description: kasA is a ketoacyl acyl carrier protein synthase that catalyzes the condensation reaction of fatty acid synthesis by the addition to an acyl acceptor of two carbons from malonyl-ACP. It is involved in elongation of fatty acids intermediate in the biosynthetic pathway of mycolic acids.

name: tetR
description: TetR is the repressor of the tetracycline resistance element; its N-terminal region forms a helix-turn-helix structure and binds DNA. Binding of tetracycline to TetR reduces the repressor affinity for the tetracycline resistance gene (tetA) promoter operator sites. Mutations arise within tetR results in lower affinity for tetracyclin

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to streptomycin
description: Point mutations within the 530 loop of the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium tuberculosis can result in resistance against streptomycin. These mutations do not directly inhibit the binding of streptomycin, but is hypothesized that they interfere with conformational perturbations that account for streptomycin's action on the ribosome.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to amikacin
description: Point mutations in the 3' domain of 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium tuberculosis can confer resistance to amikacin.

name: Chlamydophila psittaci 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutation in the 16S rRNA helix 34 region of Chlamydophila psittaci can confer resistance against spectinomycin

name: Pasteurella multocida 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the helix 34 region of 16S rRNA of Pasteurella multocida can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the helix 34 region of 16S rRNA of Neisseria gonorrhoeae can confer resistance against spectinomycin

name: Neisseria meningitidis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of Neisseria meningitidis can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: Cutibacterium acnes 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to tetracycline
description: Tetracycline binds tightly to the helix 34 domain in 16S rRNA, where it interferes sterically with the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to the ribosome A site to block protein synthesis. Mutations in the nucleotide sequence in this domain for Cutibacterium acnes can result in resistance against tetracycline.

name: Borreliella burgdorferi 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of the 16S rRNA gene of Borreliella burgdorferi can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: Borreliella burgdorferi 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to kanamycin
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of the 16S rRNA gene of Borreliella burgdorferi can confer resistance to kanamycin

name: Borreliella burgdorferi 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to gentamicin
description: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of the 16S rRNA gene of Borreliella burgdorferi can confer resistance to gentamicin

name: Helicobacter pylori 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to tetracycline
description: Tetracycline binds tightly to the helix 34 domain in 16S rRNA, where it interferes sterically with the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to the ribosome A site to block protein synthesis. Mutations in the nucleotide sequence in this domain of Helicobacter pylori can result in resistance against tetracycline.

name: Escherichia coli soxS with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance
description: SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.

name: Salmonella enterica 16S rRNA (rrsD) mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin
description: Point mutations in the helix 34 region of the rrsD 16S rRNA gene of Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium can confer resistance to spectinomycin

name: determinant of resistance to polyamine antibiotics
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to polyamine antibiotics.

name: Mycolicibacterium smegmatis 16S rRNA (rrsA) mutation conferring resistance to hygromycin B
description: Point mutations in the highly conserved helix 44 of the 16S rrsA rRNA gene of Mycolicibacterium smegmatis can confer resistance to hygromycin B. Resistance against hygromycin B is the result of conformational alterations that distorts a strong hydrogen bond leading to a change in the local geometry of the hygromycin B binding site.

name: Mycolicibacterium smegmatis 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to hygromycin B
description: Point mutations in the highly conserved helix 44 of the 16S rrsB rRNA gene of Mycolicibacterium smegmatis can confer resistance to hygromycin B. Resistance against hygromycin B is the result of conformational alterations that distorts a strong hydrogen bond leading to a change in the local geometry of the hygromycin B binding site.

description: Point mutations in the helix 44 region of the 16S rRNA rrsA gene of Mycolicibacterium smegmatis can confer resistance to viomycin.

description: Point mutations in the helix 44 region of the 16S rRNA rrsB gene of Mycolicibacterium smegmatis can confer resistance to viomycin.

name: mdtN
description: Multidrug resistance efflux pump. Could be involved in resistance to puromycin, acriflavine and tetraphenylarsonium chloride.

name: mdtO
description: Multidrug resistance efflux pump. Could be involved in resistance to puromycin, acriflavine and tetraphenylarsonium chloride

name: mdtP
description: Multidrug resistance efflux pump. Could be involved in resistance to puromycin, acriflavine and tetraphenylarsonium chloride

name: emeA
description: A multidrug efflux pump from Enterococcus faecalis. There exist efflux activity of several antimicrobial agents such as DAPI, Hoechst 33342 and acriflavine. Efflux of DAPI via EmeA was strongly inhibited by reserpine.

name: fusB
description: FusB encodes a 2-domain zinc-binding protein that binds the ribosomal translocase EF-G, causing it to dissociate from the ribosome. This action increases the ribosomal turnover rate and confers resistance to fusidic acid.

name: CepS
description: CEPS is a typical class C cephalosporinase found in Aeromonas sobria, first isolated from strain 163a.

name: tcmA
description: Major facilitator superfamily transporter. Resistance to tetracenomycin C by an active tetracenomycin C efflux system which is probably energized by transmembrane electrochemical gradients.

name: SHW beta-lactamase
description: This family of sublcass B1 beta-lactamases were discovered in species of the Shewanella genus.

name: SLB-1
description: This enzyme breaks the beta-lactam antibiotic ring open and deactivates the molecule's antibacterial properties.

name: SFB-1
description: This enzyme breaks the beta-lactam antibiotic ring open and deactivates the molecule's antibacterial properties.

name: y56 beta-lactamase
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Yersinia enterocolitica biovar 1A

name: cepA
description: A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides fragilis producing either low or high levels of the endogenous cephalosporinase activity

name: Sed-1
description: Sed-1 is a chromosomal-encoded class A beta-lactamase identified in Citrobacter sedlakii.

name: blaF
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Mycolicibacterium fortuitum

name: RCP-1
description: RCP is a class A beta-lactamase found in Rhodopseudomonas capsulata.

name: EXO-1
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Streptomyces albus G

name: R39
description: Class A beta-lactamase found in Actinomadura R39

name: magainin A
description: Magainins A are antimicrobial peptides produced by amphibians as part of their innate immune system.

name: magainin B
description: magainin B is is a synthetic analog of magainin 1, an antimicrobial peptide

name: magainin G
description: magainin G is is a synthetic analog of magainin 1, an antimicrobial peptide. It differs from magainin B by the addition of an beta-alanine at the N terminal

name: magainin H
description: magainin H is is a synthetic analog of magainin 1, an antimicrobial peptide. It differs from magainin B with the substitution of D-alanine instead of L-alanine.

name: magainin 1
description: Magainin1 is an antimicrobial peptides produced by amphibians as part of their innate immune system. It is derived from the Xenopus laevis.

name: magainin 2
description: Magainin 2 is an antimicrobial peptides produced from Xenopus laevis skin. It induce osmotic lysis of bacteria

name: LpxA
description: The LpxA gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane

name: LpxC
description: The LpxC gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane

name: LpxD
description: The LpxD gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane

name: eptA
description: PmrC mediates the modification of Lipid A by the addition of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (L-Ara4N) and phosphoethanolamine, resulting in a less negative cell membrane and decreased binding of polymyxin B.

name: ugd
description: PmrE is required for the synthesis and transfer of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) to Lipid A, which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin

name: PmrF
description: PmrF is required for the synthesis and transfer of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) to Lipid A, which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin. pmrF corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.

name: basRS
description: BasRS is a two-component regulatory system. BasR is phosphorylated by BasS at high[Fe3+] levels. The BasRS system regulates the expression of pmrE, pmrF and pmrC, leading to antibiotic resistance

name: gene altering cell wall charge
description: Genes involved in alteration of the cell wall overall charge, leading to antimicrobial resistance due to reduced binding

name: Acinetobacter mutant Lpx gene conferring resistance to colistin
description: These genes are involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane. Mutation by absence or insertion of ISAba11 sequence is a known cause of resistance in Acinetobacter baumannii▿.

name: basR
description: Response regulator for Lipid A modification genes; two-component system involved in polymyxin resistance that senses high extracellular Fe(2+)

name: basS
description: Histidine protein kinase sensor Lipid A modification gene; part of a two-component system involved in polymyxin resistance that senses high extracellular Fe(2+)

name: Klebsiella mutant PhoP conferring antibiotic resistance to colistin
description: A mutant phoP activates pmrHFIJKLM expression responsible for L-aminoarabinose synthesis and polymyxin resistance, by way of alteration of negative charge

name: charge alteration conferring antibiotic resistance
description: The loss or reduction of the net negative charge within the cell wall of gram negative bacteria is a mechanism of resistance for cationic antimicrobials that depend on the negative charge for binding to the surface

name: NmcA
description: NmcA is a class A serine beta-lactamase isolated from Enterobacter cloacae.

description: Point mutations in the bacterial 16S rRNA region shown clinically to confer resistance to tetracycline and tetracycline derivatives (polyketide antibiotics).

name: PEDO-1
description: PEDO-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter roseus exhibiting resistance to carbapenems.

name: plazomicin
description: Plazomicin is a neoglycoside, or next-generation, aminoglycoside, that has been identified as a potentially useful agent to combat drug-resistant bacteria, such as Acinetobacter baumannii and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: AAC(6')-Ib'
description: AAC(6')-Ib' is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in P. aeruginosa and P. fluorescens.

name: AAC(6')-Iaj
description: AAC(6')-Iaj is a functional acetyltransferase that modifies the amino groups at the 6' positions of aminoglycosides and contributes to aminoglycoside resistance of P. aeruginosa

name: TriABC-OpmH
description: TriABC-OpmH is a triclosan-specific efflux pump expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. TriABC is the only P. aeruginosa resistance nodulation cell division (RND) pump which contains two membrane fusion proteins, TriA and TriB, and both are required for efflux pump function. TriABC associated with OpmH assemble a functional triclosan efflux pump.

name: TriA
description: TriA is a membrane protein that is fused to TriB and both are required for the triclosan efflux pump function of TriABC-OpmH in P. aeruginosa.

name: TriB
description: TriB is a membrane protein that is fused to TriA and both are required for the triclosan efflux pump function of TriABC-OpmH in P. aeruginosa.

name: TriC
description: TriC is a resistance nodulation cell division (RND) transporter that is a part of TriABC-OpmH, a triclosan-specific efflux protein.

name: OpmH
description: OpmH is an outer membrane efflux protein required for triclosan-specific efflux pump function.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation of Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa parE conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Pseudomonas aeruginosa parE resulting in sensitivity to fluoroquinolones (ciprofloxacin). In combination with a gyrase mutation (gyrA or gyrB), it confers a high level of resistance to ciprofloxacin.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa oprD with mutation conferring resistance to imipenem
description: oprD is an outer membrane porin which facilitates the uptake of basic amino acids and imipenem in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: APH(3')-VI
description: APH(3')-VI is an aminoglycoside phosphoryltransferase that acts on the 3-OH of target of aminoglycosides.

name: PvrR
description: PvrR is a response regulator that controls the conversion between antibiotic-resistant and antibiotic-susceptible forms of Pseudomonas aeruginosa biofilms through porin deletion/gene absence

name: MCR-1.1
description: MCR-1 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase that interferes with binding of colistin to the cell membrane via addition of phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, resulting reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane.

name: sitafloxacin
description: Sitafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone active against multi-resistant Gram-positive and negative pathogens. Sitafloxacin shows inhibitory activity against DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV, which blocks bacterial DNA replication, thereby causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.

name: MexJK-OpmH
description: MexJK-OpmH is a triclosan efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexJ is the membrane fusion protein, MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter, and OpmH is the outer membrane efflux protein. MexJK is constitutively expressed in mexL mutants.

name: MexJ
description: mexJ is the membrane fusion protein of the MexJK multidrug efflux protein.

name: MexK
description: mexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter in the MexJK multidrug efflux protein.

name: MexJK-OprM
description: MexJK-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexJ is the membrane fusion protein, MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter, and OprM is the outer membrane factor protein.

name: determinant of triclosan resistance
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibacterial biocide triclosan.

name: MexPQ-OpmE
description: MexPQ-OpmE multidrug efflux pump expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexP is the membrane fusion protein; MexQ is the inner membrane transporter; and OpmE is the outer membrane channel.

name: mexP
description: MexP is the membrane fusion protein of the MexPQ-OpmE multidrug efflux complex

name: mexQ
description: MexQ is the inner membrane transporter of the multidrug efflux pump MexPQ-OpmE.

name: opmE
description: opmE is an outer membrane factor protein that is part of the multidrug efflux pump MexPQ-OpmE.

name: rokitamycin
description: Rokitamycin is a macrolide antibiotic. Synthesized from strains of Streptomyces kitasatoensis.

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA and parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
description: Point mutation in Pseudomonas aeruginosa parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance also requiring a gyrA mutation.

name: MexMN-OprM
description: MexMN-OprM is a multidrug efflux pump expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexM is the membrane fusion protein; MexN is the inner membrane transporter; and OprM is the outer membrane channel.

name: mexM
description: mexM is the membrane fusion protein of the MexMN-OprM multidrug efflux complex.

name: mexN
description: MexN is the inner membrane transporter of the MexMN-OprM multidrug efflux complex.

name: penem
description: Penems are a class of unsaturated beta-lactam antibiotics with a broad spectrum of antibacterial activity and have a structure which renders them highly resistant to beta-lactamases. All penems are all synthetically made and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. They are structurally similar to carbapenems, however, where carbapenems have a carbon, penems have a sulfur.

name: faropenem
description: Faropenem is an orally active beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the penem group.

name: panipenem
description: Panipenem is a carbapenem antibacterial agent with a broad spectrum of in vitro activity covering a wide range of Gram-negative and Gram-positive aerobic and anaerobic bacterial.  It is used in combination with betamipron to inhibit panipenem uptake into the renal tubule and prevent nephrotoxicity.

name: MexZ
description: MexZ is a transcriptional regulator that downregulates the mexXY multidrug transporter operon, which confers to aminoglycoside resistance on Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: MexL
description: MexL is a specific repressor of mexJK transcription and autoregulates its own expression.

name: VEB-1b
description: VEB-1b is a beta-lactamase that is found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: VCC-1
description: VCC-1 is a Class A carbapenemase isolated from Vibrio cholerae and exhibits resistance to penicillins, carbapenems and monobactam antibiotics.

name: PEDO-2
description: PEDO-2 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter borealis exhibiting carbapenem resistance.

name: PEDO-3
description: PEDO-3 is a class B1 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter kyungheensis exhibiting resistance to carbapenems.

name: CPS-1
description: CPS-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Chyseobacterium piscium exhibiting carbapenem resistance.

name: ESP-1
description: ESP-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Epilithonimonas tenax conferring resistance to carbapenems.

name: MSI-1
description: MSI-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Massilia oculi conferring resistance to carbapenems.

name: MSI-OXA
description: MSI-OXA is an OXA-85-like class D beta lactamase isolated from Massilia oculi.

name: SPG-1
description: SPG-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Sphingomonas sp.

name: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanI
description: This inducible cluster confers high resistance to vancomycin and intermediate resistance to teicoplanin. It achieves this through peptidoglycan restructuring with its VanA ligase homologue, VanI, causing the precursurs to end in D-Ala-D-Lac. The cluster uniquely contains murF, the final enzyme in the synthesis of UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-pentapeptide, the precursor of murein. The VanI gene cluster has been found in chromosomal DNA. Gene orientation: vanSRIWK-murFvanX

name: vanI
description: VanI is a D-Ala-D-Lac ligase that reduces vancomycin binding affinity, helping to confer vancomycin resistance as part of the VanI resistance gene cluster in Desulfitobacterium spp. and Desulfosporosinus spp.

name: vanWI
description: VanWI is a vanW variant found in the vanI gene cluster

name: vanXI
description: VanXI is a VanX variant found in the VanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster. It is a D-Ala-D-Ala dipeptidase.

name: vanSI
description: VanSI is a vanS variant found in the vanI gene cluster; it is a histidine kinase.

name: vanKI
description: VanKI is a peptidoglycan bridge formation protein also known as FemAB that is part of the VanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster.

name: vanRI
description: VanRI is the regulatory transcriptional activator in the VanSR regulator within the VanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster.

name: Staphylococcus aureus ileS with mutation conferring resistance to mupirocin
description: Point mutations to the isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase (ileS) in Staphylococcus aureus that confer resistance to mupirocin.

name: Bifidobacterium ileS conferring resistance to mupirocin
description: Bifidobacteria have an intrinsically resistant form of ileS (isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase) that confers resistance to mupirocin.

name: fusD
description: A specific fusidic acid resistance gene conferring intrinsic resistance in the bacteria Staphylococcus saprophyticus.

name: fusC
description: FusC is a fusidic acid resistance gene enabling ribosomal translocase EF-G dissociation from the ribosome that has been detected in Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus intermedius. Its mechanism is believed to be similar to fusB due to its high level of sequence homology.

name: antibiotic resistant fusA
description: Antibiotic resistant fusA is caused by mutations to the elongation factor G (EF-G) and confers resistance to fusidic acid.

name: Staphylococcus aureus fusA with mutation conferring resistance to fusidic acid
description: The mutations to this gene are involved in altering the translation elongation factor G (EF-G) in association with the ribosome to prevent fusidic acid from binding EF-G and preventing translation.

name: antibiotic resistant fusE
description: Antibiotic resistant fusE is caused by mutations in a region of the rplF gene encoding riboprotein L6, and confers resistance to fusidic acid.

name: Staphylococcus aureus fusE with mutation conferring resistance to fusidic acid
description: The mutations to the rplF gene encoding riboprotein L6 have been shown to cause fusidic acid resistance, demonstrating a potential secondary site of action of the antibiotic that is blocked through these mutations. Several types of mutations have been identified that cause resistance, including SNPs, frameshift mutations and early stop codons.

name: mphE
description: mphE is a macrolide phosphotransferase and resistance gene identified on a plasmid, pRSB105

name: mphG
description: The mphG gene encodes a macrolide 2'-phosphotransferase found in Photobacterium damselae sharing sequence similarity to mphA in E. coli.

name: vatF
description: vatF is a streptogramin A acetyl transferase gene isolated from the chromosome of Yersinia enterocolitica.

name: mefC
description: mefC is a macrolide efflux gene isolated from a plasmid in Photobacterium damselae.

name: optrA
description: OptrA is a member of the ABC-F protein subfamily that confers resistance to oxazolidinones. The gene encoding the protein was originally isolated from a plasmid in Enterococcus faecalis and Enterococcus faecium.

name: determinant of oxazolidinone resistance
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to oxazolidinone (ie., linezolid) antibiotics.

name: oleC
description: oleC is an ABC transporter isolated from Streptomyces antibioticus and is involved in oleandomycin secretion.

name: salA
description: salA is an ABC-F subfamily protein gene isolated from the chromosome of Staphylococcus sciuri conferring resistance to lincosamides and streptogramins.

name: Escherichia coli nfsA mutations conferring resistance to nitrofurantoin
description: nfsA encodes the major oxygen-insesitive nitroreductase in E. coli. The first step of resistance to nitrofurazone is mutation of nfsA.

name: determinant of pleuromutilin resistance
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics.

name: antibiotic resistant nfsA
description: The nfsA-encoded nitroreductase is the major oxygen-insensitive nitroreductase present in E. coli. NfsA uses only NADPH and has broad electron acceptor specificity. Mutations in nfsA cause resistance to nitrofurazone and furazolidone. Resistance to nitrofurantoin via mutation of nfsA reduces the fitness of clinical isolates of E. coli.

name: antibiotic resistant nfsB
description: nsfB encodes a minor oxygen-insensitive nitroreductase. NfsB reduces a broad range of nitroaromatic compounds including the antibiotics nitrofurazone and nitrofurantoin. NfsB is a flavin mononucleotide (FMN)-containing protein and uses both NADH and NADPH as a source of reducing equivalents. Mutations in nfsB lead to increased resistance to nitrofurazone and furazolidone in an nfsA mutant background.

name: Escherichia coli nfsB with mutation conferring resistance to nitrofurantoin
description: nfsB encodes the minor oxygen-insesitive nitroreductase in E. coli. The first step of resistance to nitrofurazone is mutation of nfsA, while the increased resistance associated with second step mutants is a consequence of nfsB mutation.

name: Enterococcus faecalis cls with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: cls or cardiolipin synthase is an inner membrane protein involved in membrane synthesis and phosopholipid metabolism, with mutations to the gene being capable of conferring daptomycin resistance.

name: eatAv
description: eatAv is a mutated form of the wildtype eatA ABC-F subfamily protein isolated from Enterococcus faecium conferring resistance to lincosamides, streptogramin A's and pleuromutilins (LSaP phenotype).

name: lnuE
description: lnuE encodes a lincosamide resistance gene isolated from Streptococcus suis that was truncated by an ISEnfa5-cfr-ISEnfa5 segment insertion. It shares the closest sequence similarity to lnuA.

name: determinant of nitrofuran resistance
description: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibiotic drug, nitrofurantoin

name: resistance by absence
description: Mechanism of antibiotic resistance conferred by deletion of gene (usually a porin)

name: mphM
description: mphM is a chromosomally-encoded macrolide phosphotransferases that inactivate 14-, 15- and 16-membered macrolides.

name: gene conferring resistance via absence
description: Deletion of gene or gene product results in resistance. For example, deletion of a porin gene blocks drug from entering the cell.

name: Staphylococcus aureus mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. A point mutation in the putative mprF synthase domain is associated with enhanced expression, increased synthesis and reduced daptomycin surface binding. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Listeria monocytogenes mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Brucella suis mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Clostridium perfringens mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Streptococcus agalactiae mprF
description: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.

name: Escherichia coli murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations such as Asp369Asn and Leu370Ile confers fosfomycin resistance. Extensive evidence has shown the significance of C115 mutations in conferring fosfomycin resistance since this residue represents a primary binding site for the antibiotic across many species.

name: Staphylococcus aureus murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations confers fosfomycin resistance.

name: Borreliella burgdorferi murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Mutations to the murA enzyme confers resistance to the antibiotic.

name: Mycolicibacterium smegmatis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: Mutations in the Mycolicibacterium smegmatis ndh gene that results in increased resistance to isoniazid.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis variant bovis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid
description: Mutations in the Mycobacterium tuberculosis variant bovis ndh gene that results in increased resistance to isoniazid.

name: nybomycin
description: A  heterocyclic antibiotic that targets mutant gyrA (type II topoisomerase) containing an S84L substitution, counteracting acquired quinolone resistance. It is effective against quinolone-resistant Gram-positive bacteria including S. aureus and E. faecalis. Due to its ability to counteract quinolone resistance by targeting the mutant form of the gyrA protein, it is classified as a reverse antibiotic (RA).

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis intrinsic murA conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mycobacterium tuberculosis murA confers intrinsic resistance to fosfomycin. The presence of an aspartic acid residue in place of the critical cysteine at position 117 that enables fosfomycin binding is believed to be responsible for this intrinsic resistance.

name: Chlamydia trachomatis intrinsic murA conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Chlamydia murA confers intrinsic resistance to fosfomycin. The presence of an aspartic acid residue in place of the critical cysteine at position 119 that enables fosfomycin binding is believed to be responsible for this intrinsic resistance.

name: fluoroquinolone self resistant parC
description: Inherent parC resistance to fluoroquinolone from an antibiotic producer. The presence of these genes confers self-resistance to the antibiotic it produces.

name: aminocoumarin self resistant parY
description: Inherent ParY resistant to aminocoumarin from an antibiotic producer. The presence of these genes confers self resistance to the antibiotic it produces

name: Bacillus subtilis pgsA with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: Point mutations that occur within the Bacillus subtilis pgsA gene resulting in resistance to daptomycin.

name: Campylobacter jejuni gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Campylobacter jejuni is a major bacterial infectious agent associated with gastroenteritis. Quinolone resistance is reportedly conferred by a single C-257-T nucleotide substitution in the gyrA gene.

name: Enterococcus faecium liaF mutant conferring daptomycin resistance
description: liaF is an accessory protein that acts as a negative regulator of liaRS signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis liaS mutant conferring daptomycin resistance
description: liaS is a histidine kinase found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis liaR mutant conferring daptomycin resistance
description: liaR is a response regulator found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: SPM-1
description: Plasmid-mediated SPM metallo-beta-lactamase conferring resistance to carbapenem. Originally isolated from Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Responsible for carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa (CRPA) outbreaks in Brazil.

name: Staphylococcus aureus walK with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: walK is the histidine kinase sensor of a two-component regulatory system controlling peptidoglycan metabolism through regulation of the expression of most of the peptidoglycan hydrolase genes. Mutations in the gene have been found that confer daptomycin resistance.

name: daptomycin resistant walK
description: Mutations to the walK gene, part of a cell wall metabolism 2-component regulatory system, confers resistance to antibiotics, specifically daptomycin.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii ampC beta-lactamase
description: A class C beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii that confers resistance to piperacillin and cefepime.

name: Enterococcus faecalis YybT with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: YybT has phosphodiesterase activity towards cyclic dinucleotides using a c-di-GMP hydrolyzing phosphodiesterase domain. Mutations to the gene confer resistance to daptomycin.

name: daptomycin resistant YybT
description: Mutations to the YybT gene confers daptomycin resistance

name: Enterococcus faecalis gdpD with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: gdpD is a glycerolphosphodiesterase whose mutations confer resistance to daptomycin.

name: bcr-1
description: Transmembrane protein which expels bicyclomycin from the cell, leading to bicyclomycin resistance. Identified in Pseudomonas aeruginosa strains responsible for outbreaks in Brazil, often appearing with blaSPM-1, another bicyclomycin resistance gene

name: daptomycin resistant gdpD
description: Mutations to the gdpD glycerolphosphodiesterase confer resistance to daptomycin.

name: Staphylococcus aureus agrA with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
description: agrA is an autoinducer in a peptide-quorum two-component regulatory system whose mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: daptomycin resistant agrA
description: Mutations to the regulatory gene agrA confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis gshF with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: gshF is a bifunctional glutamate-cysteine ligase/ glutathione synthetase that when mutated, confers daptomycin resistance.

name: daptomycin resistant gshF
description: Mutations to the glutathione synthetase gshF confers daptomycin resistance.

name: Escherichia coli acrR with mutation conferring multidrug antibiotic resistance
description: AcrR is a repressor of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrR mutations result in high level antibiotic resistance. The mutations associated with this model are specific to E. coli.

name: carO
description: carO is a transmembrane beta-barrel involved in the influx of carbapenem antibiotics in Acinetobacter baumannii. Disruption of the carO gene by distinct insertion elements results in a loss of carO expression causing resistance to carbapenem antibiotics. Homologs of carO have been identified in genera Acinetobacter, Moraxella and Psychrobacter.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii OprD conferring resistance to imipenem
description: An outer member protein (OMP) found in Acinetobacter baumannii involved in the uptake of imipenem and basic amino acids. This porin is homologous to Pseudomonas aeruginosa OprD, which performs an identical function.

name: kirromycin self resistant EF-Tu
description: Natural producers of kirromycin and kirromycin-like antibiotics (i.e., kirrothrycin) possess self-resistance, which is classified here

name: adeC
description: AdeC is the outer membrane factor of the AdeABC multidrug efflux complex. It can be replaced by other outer membrane channels, and is not essential for antibiotic resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis drmA with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: drmA is an uncharacterized 6-pass membrane protein, with mutations to the protein causing modest resistance to daptomycin.

name: daptomycin resistant drmA
description: Mutations to drmA confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Enterococcus faecalis YvlB with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance
description: YvlB is a putative target of the liaFSR signalling pathway, whose mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

name: daptomycin resistant YvlB
description: Mutations to the putative liaFSR target YvlB confer daptomycin resistance.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Mutations in the A subunit of DNA gyrase reduce its affinity for fluoroquinolones, thereby conferring resistance.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
description: Mutations in Acinetobacter baumannii parC that result in resistance to fluoroquinolones.

name: mgrB
description: mgrB is a small transmembrane protein produced in the PhoPQ signalling system. It acts as a negative regulator in this system. Inactivation or down-regulation of mgrB confers colistin resistance by absence as shown in Klebsiella pneumoniae

name: BAL30072
description: BAL30072 is a monocyclic beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the sulfactams. BAL30072 was found to trigger the spheroplasting and lysis of Escherichia coli rather than the formation of extensive filaments.

name: battacin
description: Battacin is a cationic lipopeptide antibiotic produced from a Paenibacillus tianmuensis soil isolate. Battacin kills bacteria in vitro and has potent activity against Gram-negative bacteria, including multidrug-resistant and extremely drug-resistant clinical isolates. The bactericidal kinetics of battacin correlate with the depolarization of the cell membrane, suggesting that battacin kills bacteria by disrupting the cytoplasmic membrane.

name: benzalkonium chloride
description: Benzalkonium chloride is a type of cationic surfactant. It is an organic salt called a quaternary ammonium compound. It has three main categories of use: as a biocide, a cationic surfactant, and as a phase transfer agent.

name: rhodamine
description: Rhodamine is a flurone dye that is often used as a tracer due to determine the rate and direction of flow and transport. It permeates the cell membrane of gram negative organisms E. coli and P. aeruginosa.

name: aminocoumarin resistant alaS
description: alanyl-tRNA synthetase conferring resistance to novobiocin in Escherichia coli

name: temocillin
description: Temocillin is a beta-lactamase resistant carboxypenicillin. It is primarily used for the treatment of multiple drug resistant, Gram-negative bacteria, specifically Enterobacteriaceae.

name: ticarcillin
description: Ticarcillin is a carboxypenicillin used for the treatment of Gram-negative bacteria, particularly P. aeruginosa. Ticarcillin's antibiotic properties arise from its ability to prevent cross-linking of peptidoglycan during cell wall synthesis, when the bacteria try to divide, causing cell death.

name: cdeA
description: Clostridioides difficile and Escherichia coli multidrug efflux transporter with antiporter function. Confers resistance to fluoroquinolones in E. coli and acriflavin in Clostridioides difficile.

name: qacH
description: qacH is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump in Vibrio cholerae

name: gadW
description: GadW is an AraC-family regulator that promotes mdtEF expression to confer multidrug resistance. GadW inhibits GadX-dependent activation. GadW clearly represses gadX and, in situations where GadX is missing, activates gadA and gadBC.

name: aminocoumarin resistant cysB
description: Positive regulator of gene expression in the cysteine regulon. cysB mutants confer resistance to novobiocin, an aminocoumarin antibiotic, in Escherichia coli.

name: kdpE
description: kdpE is a transcriptional activator that is part of the two-component system KdpD/KdpE that is studied for its regulatory role in potassium transport and has been identified as an adaptive regulator involved in the virulence and intracellular survival of pathogenic bacteria. kdpE regulates a range of virulence loci through direct promoter binding.

name: MUS-2
description: MUS-2 is a chromosome-encoded beta-lactamase from Myroides odoratimimus.

name: leuO
description: leuO, a LysR family transcription factor, exists in a wide variety of bacteria of the family Enterobacteriaceae and is involved in the regulation of as yet unidentified genes affecting the stress response and pathogenesis expression. LeuO is also an activator of the MdtNOP efflux pump.

name: mfd
description: mfd dissociates transcription elongation complexes blocked at nonpairing lesions and mediates recruitment of DNA repair proteins. The Mfd (mutation frequency decline) protein, also known as transcription-repair coupling factor, is responsible for ATP-dependent removal of stalled RNA polymerase from DNA lesions by inducing forward movement of the RNA polymerase and subsequent recruitment of nucleotide excision repair machinery to the sites of the lesions.

name: ADC beta-lactamase without carbapenemase activity
description: ADC beta-lactamases, also known as AmpC beta-lactamases, are cephalosporinases with extended-spectrum resistance to cephalosporins but not to carbapenems. ADC beta-lactamases are found in Acinetobacter sp. and Oligella urethralis.

name: ADC-1
description: ADC-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-2
description: ADC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Oligella urethralis.

name: ADC-3
description: ADC-3 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-4
description: ADC-4 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-5
description: ADC-5 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-6
description: ADC-6 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-7
description: ADC-7 is a beta-lactamase that is found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-8
description: ADC-8 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter sp.

name: ADC-10
description: ADC-10 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-12
description: ADC-12 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-13
description: ADC-13 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-14
description: ADC-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-15
description: ADC-15 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-16
description: ADC-16 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-17
description: ADC-17 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-18
description: ADC-18 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-19
description: ADC-19 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-20
description: ADC-20 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-21
description: ADC-21 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-22
description: ADC-22 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-23
description: ADC-23 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-25
description: ADC-25 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-31
description: ADC-31 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-39
description: ADC-39 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-41
description: ADC-41 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-42
description: ADC-42 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-43
description: ADC-43 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: Enterococcus faecium EF-Tu mutants conferring resistance to elfamycin
description: Sequence variants of Enterococcus faecium elongation factor Tu that confer resistance to elfamycin antibiotics.

name: ADC-44
description: ADC-44 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.

name: ADC-56
description: ADC-56 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-61
description: ADC-61 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-74
description: ADC-74 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-75
description: ADC-75 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-76
description: ADC-76 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-77
description: ADC-77 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-78
description: ADC-78 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-79
description: ADC-79 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-80
description: ADC-80 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-81
description: ADC-81 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: ADC-82
description: ADC-82 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: Escherichia coli GlpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Point mutations to the active importer GlpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: Escherichia coli UhpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mutations to the active importer UhpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: Escherichia coli UhpA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: uhpA is a positive activator of the fosfomycin importer uhpT, thus mutations to uhpA confer fosfomycin resistance by reducing uhpT expression. Both knockout and amino acid substitution mutations have been found that confer resistance, with the Protein Knockout model describing the large, knockout mutations causing loss of function of the gene, and the Protein Variant model describing the amino acid substitutions.

name: Rm3
description: Rm3 is a class B3 metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from a metagenomic soil sample in Yorkshire, United Kingdom, shown to confer resistance to clinically used penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.

name: Pseudomonas mutant PhoP conferring resistance to colistin
description: Mutations in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PhoP of the two-component PhoPQ regulatory system. Presence of mutation confers resistance to colistin.

name: Pseudomonas mutant PhoQ conferring resistance to colistin
description: Mutations in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PhoQ of the two-component PhoPQ regulatory system. Presence of mutation confers resistance to colistin

name: tedizolid
description: Tedizolid is a synthetic oxazolidinone antibiotic that is administered to the patient as a prodrug that is activated in vivo. It acts as an inhibitor of protein synthesis by binding the 50S subunit of the ribosome and preventing formation of the 70S initiation complex. It is active against Gram-positive pathogens.

name: lugdunin
description: Lugdunin is a thiazolidine-containing cyclic peptide antibiotic isolated from nasal Staphylococcus lugnunensis that prohibits Staphylococcus aureus colony formation. It is a human commensal bacteria, indicating the potential for further antibiotic discoveries from human microbiota.

name: Escherichia coli PtsI with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: PtsI (phosphoenolpyruvate-protein phosphotransferase) is involved in cyclic AMP synthesis, which regulates glpT expression. As a result, mutations to ptsI confer resistance to fosfomycin by affecting the regulation of fosfomycin import.

name: Escherichia coli cyaA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: CyaA (adenylate cyclase) is involved with the synthesis of cyclic AMP which regulates the fosfomycin transporter glpT. As a result, mutations to cyaA confer resistance to fosfomycin.

name: Staphylococcus aureus GlpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mutations to the active importer GlpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: Staphylococcus aureus UhpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin
description: Mutations to the active importer UhpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

name: thusin
description: Thusin is a two-component lantibiotic isolated from B. thuringiensis strain BGSC 4BT1, exhibiting antimicrobial activity against several Gram-positive pathogens. Bacillus cereus, Listeria monocytogenes, Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), Staphylococcus sciuri, Enterococcus faecalis, and Streptococcus pneumoniae have all shown susceptibility to Thusin, with inhibition activities greater than Vancomycin or other lantibiotics.

name: formicin
description: Formicin is a two-component broad-spectrum lantibiotic produced by Bacillus paralicheniformis APC 1576, exhibiting antimicrobial activity against several Gram-positive species, including Staphylococcus aureus, Clostridioides difficile and Listeria monocytogenes.

name: ANT(4')-Ib
description: Kanamycin nucleotidyltransferase sequence from Staphylococcus aureus plasmid. Confers resistance to kanamycin, neomycin and other aminoglycosides

name: cipA
description: Cfr-like methyltransferase enzyme conferring resistance to multiple clinically relevant antibiotic classes.

name: Erm(47)
description: Chromosome-encoded gene conferring MLSB resistance. Identified from Helcococcus kunzii.

name: cycB
description: Cytochrome c5 protein. Pseudomonas PA14 mutant cycB confers resistance to aminoglycoside Tobramycin. Resistance only detected in vitro.

name: Lysocin E
description: A drug which binds to menaquinone in the bacterial cell membrane. Binding of Lysocin to menaquinone facilitates lysis of the cell.

name: menaquinone
description: A molecule involved in electron transport in bacterial cell membrane.

name: Staphylococcus aureus menA with mutation conferring resistance to lysocin
description: menA encodes a 1,4-dihydroxy-2-naphthoate octaprenyltransferase, with mutations to the protein conferring resistance to lysocin E.

name: apmA
description: Plasmid-borne apramycin-resistant aminocyclitol acetyltransferase gene identified from bovine MRSA.

name: lysocin
description: Lysocin family of peptide antibiotics isolated from Lysobacter spp.

name: pgpB
description: A gene that produces the protein lipid A 4'-phosphatase

name: oqxAB
description: oqxAB encodes for OqxAB, a plasmid-encoded efflux pump, which confer resistance to multiple agents including fluoroquinolones.

name: oqxA
description: RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

name: oqxB
description: RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

name: Haemophilus parainfluenzae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation of Haemophilus parainfluenzae gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and GyrA. Thus, conferring resistance. Both Ser and Tyr are hydrophilic amino acids, however Tyr has an additional bulky hydrophobic group which could affect the interaction between the DNA gyrase with quinolones

name: Haemophilus parainfluenzae parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation of Haemophilus parainfluenzae parC resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and ParC. Thus, conferring resistance.

name: Salmonella enterica gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Salmonella gyrA that confer resistance to Nalidixic acid, a fluoroquinolone antibiotic. These mutations have also been shown to reduce susceptibility to ciprofloxacin.

name: ceftolozane
description: a 5th generation cephalosporin antibiotic

name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Neisseria gonorrhoeae DNA gyrase subunit A. Decreases affinity between fluoroquinolone antibiotic molecule and gyrA, thereby conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

name: Neisseria gonorrhoeae parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
description: Point mutations in Neisseria gonorrhoeae parC protein that confer resistance to fluoroquinolone by reducing affinity to antibiotic binding site

name: rpsJ
description: rpsJ is a tetracycline resistance protein identified in Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Tetracycline resistance is conferred by binding to the ribosome as a 30S ribosomal protection protein.

name: Capnocytophaga gingivalis gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in Capnocytophaga gingivalis that decreases binding affinity of fluoroquinolone antibiotics to gyrA, thereby conferring resistance.

name: antibiotic efflux inhibitor
description: Compounds and molecules that inhibit the action of antibiotic efflux proteins, thereby decreasing resistance caused by efflux pumps

name: Berberine
description: Berberine is a benzylisoquinoline alkaloid shown to reduce MexXY-dependent antibiotic resistance of cephalosporins, macrolides, lincosamides and aminoglycosides in Pseudomonas, Burkholderia and Achromobacter

name: omadacycline
description: a aminomethylcycline antibiotic that targets 16s rRNA in gram positive and gram negative bacteria

name: Neisseria meningititis PBP2 conferring resistance to beta-lactam
description: Point mutation in Neisseria meningititis PBP2 (penA) decreases affinity between beta-lactam antibiotic molecule and PBP2, thereby conferring resistance to beta-lactam.

name: Penicillin-binding protein mutations conferring resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics
description: Mutations in PBP transpeptidases that change the affinity for penicillin thereby conferring resistance to penicillin antibiotics

name: Salmonella enterica parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Salmonella parC gene implicated in decreased susceptibility to fluoroquinolone antibiotics, primarily ciprofloxacin and nalidixic acid.

name: Shigella flexneri gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutations in Shigella flexneri gyrA observed to confer resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics.

name: Shigella flexneri parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones
description: Point mutation in parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics in Shigella flexneri,

name: abcA
description: AbcA is a multidrug resistant ABC transporter that confers resistance to methicillin, daptomycin, cefotaxime, and moenomycin.

name: EfrAB
description: EfrAB is a heterodimeric ABC transporter efflux pump found in Enterococcus faecalis and Enterococcus faecium that confers resistance to ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, rifampicin, quinupristine.

name: efrA
description: efrA is a part of the EfrAB efflux pump, and both efrA and efrB are necessary to confer drug resistance.

name: efrB
description: efrB is a part of the EfrAB efflux pump, and both efrA and efrB are necessary to confer multidrug resistance.

name: msbA
description: MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A, a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane, and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.

name: microcin J25
description: microcin J25 is a peptide antibiotic that inhibits transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase. MccJ25 is produced by Escherichia coli strains that harbor a plasmid-borne antibiotic-synthesis and antibiotic-export cassette, consisting of a gene for MccJ25 precursor (a 58 residue linear peptide), two genes for factors that process MccJ25 precursor into MccJ25, and one gene for export of MccJ25.

name: YojI
description: YojI mediates resistance to the peptide antibiotic microcin J25 when it is expressed from a multicopy vector. YojI is capable of pumping out microcin molecules.
