description: Any strain of an Acinetobacter spp. that has either tested Intermediate or Resistant to at least one antibiotic drug in at least 3 of the 6 following categories: 1) Extended-spectrum cephalosporins, 2) Fluoroquinolone, 3) Aminoglycosides, 4) Carbapenems, 5) Piperacillin group, and 6) Ampicillin/sulbactam

name: carbapenem-resistant Escherichia coli
description: Any strain of E. coli that has tested resistant to one of the following carbapenem antibiotics: imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ertapenem.

name: extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Escherichia coli
description: Any E.coli that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: ceftriaxone, ceftazidime, cefepime, and cefotaxime

name: fluoroquinolone-resistant Escherichia coli
description: Any E.coli that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, and moxifloxacin.

name: multidrug-resistant Escherichia coli
description: Any E.coli that has tested either intermediate (I) or resistant (R) to at least one drug in at least 3 of the following 5 categories: 1) Extended-spectrum cephalosporins, 2) Fluoroquinolones (ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, moxifloxacin), 3) Aminoglycosides (amikacin, gentamicin, tobramycin), 4) Carbapenems (imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ertapenem), 5) Piperacillin Group (piperacillin, piperacillin/tazobactam)

name: carbapenem-resistant Enterobacter
description: Any Enterobacter spp. that has tested resistant to at least one of the following antibiotic drugs: imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ertapenem.

name: extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Enterobacter
description: Any Enterobacter spp. that has tested resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: ceftriaxone, ceftazidime, cefepime, and/or cefotaxime.

name: multidrug-resistant Enterobacter
description: Any Enterobacter spp. that has tested either Intermediate or Resistant to at least one drug in at least 3 of the following categories: extended-spectrum cephalosporins, fluoroquinolones, aminoglycosides, carbapenems, and/or pipericillin/tazobactam

name: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella
description: Any Klebsiella oxytoca or Klebsiella pneumoniae that has tested resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ertapenem.

name: extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Klebsiella
description: Any Klebsiella oxytoca or Klebsiella pneumoniae that has tested resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: ceftriaxone, ceftazidime, cefepime, and/or cefotaxime.

name: multidrug-resistant Klebsiella
description: Any Klebsiella oxytoca or Klebsiella pneumoniae that has tested Intermediate or Resistant in at least 3 of the following categories: extended-spectrum cephalosporins, fluoroquinolones, aminoglycosides, carbapenems, or pipericillin/tazobactam

name: carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa
description: Any strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested either Intermediate or Resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: imipenem, meropenem and/or doripenem

name: extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa
description: Any strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested Resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: cefepime and/or ceftazidime

name: MCR-4.1
description: MCR-4 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase variant of MCR-1, isolated from Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium of porcine origin in Italy, Spain and Belgium through 2013 and 2015-2016. MCR-4 confers resistance to collistin via addition of a phosphoethanolamine group to lipid A, reducing the negative charge of the cell membrane. Described by Carattoli et al. 2017.

name: fluoroquinolone-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa
description: Any Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin

name: aminoglycoside-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa
description: Any Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: amikacin, gentamicin, tobramycin

name: pipericillin-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa
description: Any Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: piperacillin, piperacillin/tazobactam

name: vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus
description: Any Enterococcus faecium or Enterococcus faecalis that has tested resistant (R) to vancomycin

name: daptomycin-resistant Enterococcus
description: Any Enterococcus faecium or Enterococcus faecalis that has tested non-susceptible (NS) to daptomycin

name: vancomycin-resistant coagulase-negative Staphylococci
description: Coagulase-Negative Staphylococci that has tested resistant(R) or intermediate(I) to vancomycin

name: MCR-5.1
description: MCR-5 is a transposon-associated phosphoethanolamine transferase gene, identified in Salmonella Paratyphi B dTa+ (d-tartrate fermenting Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Paratyphi B) isolates from food-producing animals. The isolates were collected between 2011 and 2013, and retrieved from the German National Reference Laboratory for Salmonella. MCR-5 confers resistance to collistin through the addition of a phosphoethanolamine group to lipid A, causing a reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane. Described by Borowiak et al, 2017.

name: triclosan resistant gyrA
description: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Point mutations in gyrA have been shown to decrease susceptibility to the antibiotic triclosan. Although the mechanism is unclear, it is hypothesized that changes in supercoiling activity of mutant DNA gyrase proteins alters expression of stress response pathways thereby indirectly decreasing triclosan susceptibility. It has been shown that triclosan does not interact directly with gyrA.

name: Salmonella enterica gyrA with mutation conferring resistance to triclosan
description: Point mutations in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium which have been shown to increase the minimum inhibitory concentration of the antibiotic triclosan. It is hypothesized that decreased susceptibility to triclosan in Salmonella gyrA mutants occurs indirectly due to alterations in the stress response pathways.

name: Escherichia coli gyrA with mutation conferring resistance to triclosan
description: Point mutations in Escherichia coli which have been shown to increase the minimum inhibitory concentration of the antibiotic triclosan. It is hypothesized that decreased susceptibility to triclosan in E. coli gyrA mutants occurs indirectly due to alterations in the stress response pathways.

name: PDC-73
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: PDC-74
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-75
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-76
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-77
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-78
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-79
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-80
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-81
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-82
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-83
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-84
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-85
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-86
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-87
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-88
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-89
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-90
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-91
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-92
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: PDC-93
description: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: catV
description: A chloramphenicol acetyltransferase identified in Brevibacillus brevis and shown to confer resistance to chloramphenicol antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2017.

name: ACI beta-lactamase
description: A family of class A beta-lactamase enzymes described in the gram-negative cocci Acidaminococcus fermentans.

name: ACI-1
description: A class A beta-lactamase described in Acidaminococcus fermentans. ACI-1 was the first description of a beta-lactamase enzyme in a gram-negative anaerobic cocci. Described by Galan et al 2000.

name: antimicrobial resistance testing reference standard
description: Uses breakpoints to create standards for interpreting the clinical outcome of an MIC value for a particular microbial species and antimicrobial agent

name: sul4
description: sul4 is a dihydropteroate synthase gene and mobile sulfonamide resistance gene shown to confer resistance when expressed in E. coli.

name: OXA-535
description: A chromosome-carried OXA-48-like beta-lactamase, OXA-535, identified in Shewanella spp. JAB-1. Likely the progenitor to the plasmid-carried OXA-436. Expression of OXA-535 in E. coli demonstrated carbapenem-hydrolyzing activity. Described by Jousset et al. 2017.

name: lipid A acyltransferase
description: Lipid A acyltransferase genes confer resistance to certain types of peptide antibiotics such as polymyxins through the aminoacylation of lipopolysaccharide, thereby decreasing the negative charge of the outer membrane surface.

name: almG
description: A member of the AlmEFG operon, responsible for polymyxin resistance in Vibrio cholerae. AlmG is a glycyltransferase closely related to lipid A acyltransferases. Described by Henderson JC et al. 2017.

name: British Society for Antimicrobial Chemotherapy (BSAC)
description: BSAC is a British inter-professional organisation involved in antibiotic education, research and leadership. Baquero F. found that the BSAC system recommends lower breakpoints than the consensus standard of all systems for antimicrobial susceptibility testing used in Europe (BSAC, DIN, SFM, SIR, NCCLS and WRG).

name: Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute (CLSI)
description: The Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute develops and implements clinical laboratory testing standards.

name: Deutsches Institut für Normung (DIN)
description: DIN is recognized by the Federal Government of Germany as the competent standards organization for Germany and as the national standards body representing Germany in non-governmental international standards organizations. Baquero F. found that the DIN system recommends lower breakpoints than the consensus standard of all systems for antimicrobial susceptibility testing used in Europe (BSAC, DIN, SFM, SIR, NCCLS and WRG).

name: European Committee on Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing (EUCAST)
description: EUCAST is a standing committee jointly organized by ESCMID, ECDC and European national breakpoint committees; it deals with breakpoints and technical aspects of phenotypic in-vitro antimicrobial susceptibility testing.

name: Société Française de Microbiologie (SFM)
description: The French Society of Microbiology (SFM) is a non-profit association which aims to bring together microbiologists from French-speaking countries, working in the domains of bacteria, viruses, Fungi and parasites, and related medical, industrial and environmental microbiology, physiology, genetics, taxonomy, hygiene, and antimicrobial agents. Baquero F. found that the SFM system recommends higher breakpoints than the consensus standard of all systems for antimicrobial susceptibility testing used in Europe (BSAC, DIN, SFM, SIR, NCCLS and WRG).

name: minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC)
description: Minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC), in microbiology, is the lowest concentration of an antimicrobial that will inhibit the visible growth of a microorganism after overnight incubation.

name: MIC value
description: The measured or quantified MIC

name: MIC unit
description: mg/L

name: malacidin A
description: A calcium-dependent cyclic lipopeptide found to be effective against multidrug-resistant Staphylococcus aureus in cutaneous wound infections.

name: malacidin biosynthesis
description: Biosynthesis of malacidin A and malacidin B calcium-dependent cyclic lipopeptide antibiotics from uncultured soil bacteria.

name: bicyclomycin biosynthesis
description: Biosynthesis of the broad-spectrum Rho transcription factor inhibitor bicyclomycin by hydroxylation of a tRNA-dependent cyclodipeptide synthase core.

name: QepA3
description: A plasmid-mediate quinolone efflux pump described in Klebsiella aerogenes and Escherichia coli. QepA3 confers resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics by expelling the antibiotic molecules from the cell. This is distinct from the usual chromosomal mutation mechanism of quinolone resistance. Described by Wang et al. 2017.

name: QepA4
description: A plasmid-mediated quinolone efflux pump variant described in Escherichia coli. QepA4 confers resistance to quinolone and fluoroquinolone antibiotics by expulsion from the cell. Described by Manageiro et al. 2017.

name: vaborbactam
description: Antibiotic adjuvant and beta-lactamase inhibitor, often paired with meropenem for clinical use.

name: in-vivo microbial susceptibility test
description: An experimental test conducted inside of a living organism, none of which currently exist for antimicrobial resistance testing

name: in-vitro microbial susceptibility test
description: An experimental test conducted outside of a living organism, usually in a tube or plate.

name: reagent or protocol used for testing AMR
description: Reagents and procedures used during microbial susceptibility testing.

name: antimicrobial resistance test platform
description: System of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility.

name: diffusion method
description: Microbial species are inoculated in a growth medium onto which antimicrobial agents are transferred by diffusion.

name: thin-layer chromatography (TLC)-bioautography
description: Components of complex mixtures such as plant extracts are separated across a TLC plate and tested for anti-microbial activity.

name: time-kill test
description: Allows for time-dependent or concentration-dependent analysis of antimicrobial effects. Several tubes of broth culture medium containing a suspension of the test microbe are treated with varying concentrations of the antimicrobial agent and the percentage of dead cells determined at various time points.

name: ATP bioluminescence assay
description: Relies on the indirect measurement of microbe populations by quantifying microbial ATP production.

name: flow cytofluorometric method
description: Microbes exposed to antimicrobial agents are then stained with the intercalating agent propidium iodide. Damaged cells emit a positive signal that is detected by flow cytometry analysis. Flow cytometry can also be used to discriminate between dead, damaged and live cells.

name: mechanism-specific test
description: Test that directly detect the presence of a particular resistance mechanism.

name: broth dilution method
description: The microbial species are inoculated in liquid growth medium containing incremental dilutions (usually 2-fold) of the antimicrobial agent.

name: automated testing platform
description: Automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility.

name: manual testing platform
description: Non-automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility.

name: MicroScan
description: Specific automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility developed by Omron.

name: Phoenix
description: Specific automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility developed by Becton Dickinson.

name: Sensitire
description: Specific automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility developed by Trek, Thermo Fisher Scientific.

name: Vitek System
description: Specific automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility developed by bioMérieux.

name: automated testing platform vendor
description: Vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility.

name: Becton Dickinson
description: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility headquartered in New Jersey, USA. Becton Dickinson is the developer of the Phoenix automated testing platform.

name: bioMérieux
description: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility headquartered in France. bioMérieux is the developer of the Vitek automated testing platform.

name: Siemens
description: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility headquartered in Berlin and Munich.

name: Omron
description: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility based in Japan. Omron is the developer of the MicroScan automated testing platform.

name: Trek
description: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility that was acquired by Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. Thermo Fisher Scienfiic Inc. is headquartered in Massachusetts, USA.  Trek is the developer of the Sensitire automated testing platform.

name: micro broth dilution method
description: Broth dilution conducted on 96-well microtiter plates (≤200 µL per well).

name: agar well diffusion method
description: This test is a common method of evaluating the antimicrobial activity of plants or microbial extracts. In this method, bacteria are inoculated onto agar plates and the antimicrobial agent is injected into the plate and allowed to diffuse.

name: agar plug diffusion method
description: This method is commonly used to study the antagonism between microorganisms. The first bacterial strain is inoculated onto agar plates in tight streaks. The bacteria will secrete molecules that diffuse in the agar medium; this medium is cut and placed on another agar plate inoculated with another microorganism.

name: cross streak method
description: This method is commonly used to study the antagonism between microorganisms. The microbial strain of interest is seeded by a single streak in the center of the agar plate. After incubation, the plate is seeded with the second microorganism by single streak perpendicular to the central streak.

name: agar diffusion bioautography
description: The antimicrobial agent is transferred from a chromatogram to an agar plate previously inoculated with the test microorganism.

name: direct bioautography
description: A developed TLC plate is dipped into or sprayed with a microbial suspension and then incubated. Live microbial cells are visualized using tetrazolium salts.

name: agar overlay bioautography
description: The TLC plate is covered with a molten agar medium seeded with the test microbe and the antimicrobial compounds are allowed to diffuse onto the agar medium. Tetrazolium dye staining allows for visualization.

name: inoculum
description: Concentration at which bacterial cells in suspension, calculated with respect to final volume (colony forming units/milliliter (cfu/mL)). The standard for broth dilution is 5 x 105cfu/mL. The standard for agar dilution is 104cfu/mL.

name: growth medium
description: Medium that supports microorganism growth.

name: chromogenic cephalosporinase test
description: Assay for beta lactamase detection

name: chloramphenicol acetyltransferase assay (CAT)
description: Commercial colorimetric assay for detection of chloramphenicol modifying enzyme chloramphenicol acetyltransferase.

name: greater than standard inoculum
description: Greater than 5 x 105 cfu/mL for broth dilution and 104 cfu/mL for agar dilution.

name: less than standard inoculum
description: Less than 5 x 105 cfu/mL for broth dilution and 104 cfu/mL for agar dilution.

name: = standard inoculum
description: Around equal to 5 x 105 cfu/mL for broth dilution and 104 cfu/mL for agar dilution.

name: Mueller-Hinton Broth
description: General purpose medium used for culture of nonfastidious microorganisms.

name: CO2 supplemented medium
description: Incubation atmosphere supplemented with CO2.

name: divalent cation supplemented medium
description: Medium supplementation with 20–25 mg Ca2+ and 10–12.5 mg Mg2+ per liter, which is representative of the divalent cation concentration in blood. Divalent cation supplemented medium is correct to use for susceptibility testing of tetracyclines, daptomycin for gram-positive bacteria and aminoglycosides for Pseudomonas aeruginosarequires.

name: NaCl supplemented medium
description: Growth medium supplemented with 2% (wt/vol) sodium chloride for testing susceptibility of Staphylococcus aureus to methicillin, oxacillin and nafcillin.

name: Difco Mueller-Hinton Broth
description: Low thymine and thymidine content.

name: BBL Mueller-Hinton Broth
description: High thymine and thymidine content.

name: antimicrobial resistance tissue specificity
description: The tissue type used to select breakpoints from a particular standard, for the interpretation of MIC results.

name: EUCAST antimicrobial phenotype
description: Qualitative description of a microbial response to antimicrobial agents as described by EUCAST using breakpoints determined through in-vitro testing.  These breakpoints are determined irrespective of tissue specificity of infection.

name: wild-type
description: A microbe whose susceptibility to antibiotics is comparable to that of a reference susceptible microbe, meaning that the microbe is sensitive to the particular antibiotic.

name: non wild-type
description: A microbe whose susceptibility to antibiotics differs from that of a reference susceptible microbe, meaning that the microbe is resistant to the particular antibiotic.

name: AMR testing vendor
description: Vendor of AMR testing equipment and reagents.

name: component of AMR phenotype measurement
description: Details required in reporting antimicrobial resistance.

name: CLSI antimicrobial phenotype
description: Qualitative description of a microbial response to antimicrobial agents as described by CLSI using breakpoints that take into consideration tissue specificity of infection.

name: tet(59)
description: Tet(59) is a chromosome-encoded tetracycline efflux pump described from a Chinese pig manure sample.

name: tet(W/N/W)
description: tet(W/N/W) is a mosaic tetracycline resistance gene and ribosomal protection protein.

name: RSA beta-lactamase
description: A family of class A beta-lactamase enzymes, RSA beta-lactamases show carbapenemase and cephalosporinase activity

name: RSA-1
description: RSA-1 is a class A beta-lactamase resistance enzyme identified from a functional metagenomic study of contaminated river sediments.

name: RSA-2
description: RSA-2 is a class A beta-lactamase enzyme identified from a functional metagenomics study of contaminated river sediments in India.

name: Haemophilus influenzae PBP3 conferring resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics
description: PBP3 is a penicillin-binding protein and beta-lactam resistance enzyme encoded by the ftsI gene in Haemophilus influenzae. Mutations in ftsI confer resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics.

name: HERA beta-lactamase
description: A class A beta-lactamase family shown to hydrolyze penicillin but without cephalosporinase activity.

name: HERA-1
description: A class A beta-lactamase with penicillinase activity described in Atlantibacter (Escherichia) hermannii

name: TRU beta-lactamase
description: A class C beta-lactamase endogenous to Aeromonas enteropelogenes (tructi)

name: TRU-1
description: A class C beta-lactamase enzyme identified from Aeromonas enteropelogenes. TRU-1 confers resistance to penicillin and cephalosporin antibiotics.

name: Agrobacterium fabrum chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in the Gram-negative bacterium Agrobacterium fabrum.

name: Bacillus clausii chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in Bacillus clausii.

name: Campylobacter coli chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in Campylobacter coli.

name: Streptococcus suis chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in Streptococcus suis.

name: Enterococcus faecium chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in an Enterococcus faecium plasmid

name: Staphylococcus intermedius chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in Staphylococcus intermedius

name: Enterococcus faecalis chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol acetyltransferase and resistance determinant described in Enterococcus faecalis

name: Vibrio anguillarum chloramphenicol acetyltransferase
description: A chloramphenicol resistance determinant described in a Vibrio anguillarum plasmid sequence

name: delafloxacin
description: Delafloxacin is a novel fluoroquinolone antibiotic, differentiated from other on-market fluoroquinolones by the absence of a protonatable substituent conferring a weakly acidic character to the molecule. This property results in increased intracellular penetration and enhanced bactericidal activity under acidic conditions.

name: EBR-2
description: EBR-2 is a novel EBR-like class B beta-lactamase isolated from an extensively drug-resistant strain of Empedobacter falsenii

name: CFE-2
description: CFE-2 is a plasmid-encoded AmpC beta-lactamase first described from Citrobacter freundii by Chen et al. 2018.

name: intrinsic colistin resistant phosphoethanolamine transferase
description: Chromosomally-encoded phosphoethanolamine (PEtN) transferases shown to confer resistance to polymyxin antibiotics, including colistin.

name: ICR-Mc
description: A chromosomally-encoded colistin resistance phosphoethanolamine (PEtN) transferase of Moraxella catarrhalis. ICR-Mc is the protein that represents the closest known ortholog to the colistin resistance MCR-1 and MCR-2 PEtN transferases.

name: ciprofloxacin phosphotransferase
description: A class of phosphotransferase enzymes shown to confer resistance to ciprofloxacin by antibiotic inactivation through phosphorylation.

name: CrpP
description: A plasmid-encoded ciprofloxacin resistance protein identified from a Pseudomonas aeruginosa plasmid. CrpP confers resistance to ciprofloxacin by antibiotic inactivation through phosphorylation. Described by Chavez-Jacobo et al. 2018.

name: ABC-F ATP-binding cassette ribosomal protection protein
description: A subfamily of the ATP-binding cassette protein superfamily. Unlike other ABC proteins, ABC-F genes are not fused to a transmembrane domain nor associated with transport. It has been shown that ABC-F proteins confer antibiotic resistance via ribosomal protection and not antibiotic efflux as in other ABC proteins.

name: poxtA
description: PoxtA is an ABC-F subfamily ATP-binding cassette protein that confers resistance to tetracycline, -phenicol, and oxazolidinone via modification of the bacterial ribosome. The encoding gene was isolated from a methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus strain.

name: msr-type ABC-F protein
description: msr-type ABC-F subfamily ribosomal protection proteins expression in Staphylococci species and confer resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics through antibiotic target protection mechanisms.

name: lsa-type ABC-F protein
description: A subgroup of the ABC-F protein subfamily of ATP-binding cassette proteins. lsa-type ABC-F proteins confer resistance to streptogramin, lincosamide and pleuromutilin antibiotics through antibiotic target protection of the ribosome.

name: tebipenem
description: A carbapenem antibiotic, administered as the oral drug tebipenem-pivoxil, shown to be effective at treating bacterial infections.

name: cefiderocol
description: A siderophore cephalosporin with antibiotic activity against Gram-negative pathogens including and specifically Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: vmlR
description: vmlR is an ABC-F ATPase ribosomal protection protein identified in Bacillus subtilus. Shown to confer resistance to lincomycin and streptogramin A virginiamycin. Described by Crowe-McAuliffe et al. 2018.

name: eremomycin pyrrolidide
description: Eremomycin pyrrolidide (5) is a semisynthetic glycopeptides 3-6 that is derived from vancomycin or eremomycin. It has high activity against staphylococci and enterococci, including vancomycin-resistant strains.

name: OXA-665
description: Beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter rudis efficiently inactivating carbapenems and amoxicillin conferring resistance to cephalosporins

name: OXA-664
description: Beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter spp. efficiently inactivating carbapenems and amoxicillin conferring resistance to cephalosporins

name: Bifidobacterium adolescentis rpoB mutants conferring resistance to rifampicin
description: Bifidobacterium are antibiotic resistant probiotics are prescribed to upkeep the population beneficial bacteria in the gut microbiome. However, horizontal gene transfer among gut microbes could create harmful antibiotic-resistant pathogenic bacteria, such as Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Lokesh et al. analyzed Bifidobacterium antitubercular drug resistance and mutations in rpoB. They found that B. animalis, B. longum and B. adolescentis showed considerable resistance to pyrazinamide, isoniazid, and streptomycin, while B. adolescentis had mutations both in the rifampicin (RIF) pocket and in regions outside the pockets, and also showed considerable resistance to RIF.

name: OXA-663
description: An OXA-10 family class beta-lactamase identified from a Klebsiella pneumoniae BIDMC 35 isolate.

name: delamanid
description: A novel nitroimidazole antibiotic for treating Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection. Delamanid inhibits bacterial cell wall growth by mycolic acid synthesis disruption and is particularly effective in combination therapies against multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

name: diarylquinoline antibiotic
description: A class of antibiotics used to treat specifically Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection; therefore, referred to as an antimycobacterial. Diarylquinoline antibiotics inhibit ATP synthesis in tuberculosis cells by disruption of mycobacterial ATP synthase.

name: bedaquiline
description: A diarylquinoline antibiotic drug sold under the brand name Sirturo, used to treat infection from Mycobacterium spp., particularly multidrug-resistant tuberculosis. Bedaquiline disrupts ATP synthase by proton pump blockage, inhibiting ATP synthesis.

name: ADC-68
description: A class C carbapenemase and extended-spectrum beta-lactamase identified from Acinetobacter baumannii

name: IMP-55
description: An IMP class B metallo-beta-lactamase enzyme identified from Acinetobacter baumannii.

name: IMP-56
description: An IMP class B metallo-beta-lactamase enzyme identified from carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa

name: KPC-24
description: A KPC class A beta-lactamase and carbapenemase identified from Chilean isolates of Klebsiella pneumoniae.

name: dfrB4
description: A trimethoprim-resistant dihydrofolate reductase characterized on a class I integron from an E. coli isolate.

name: Tosufloxacin
description: Tosufloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic with an extended spectrum of activity.

name: MCR-3.11
description: An MCR-3 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin resistance gene variant differing by 2 amino acid substitutions, identified from an Escherichia coli isolate.

name: MCR-6.1
description: An MCR-2 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin resistance gene variant identified in Moraxella isolated from pigs in the United Kingdom.

name: MCR-2.2
description: An MCR-2 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin resistance gene variant identified in Moraxella isolated from pigs in Great Britain

name: MCR-3.6
description: An MCR-3 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin resistance gene variant identified in Aeromonas.

name: MCR-3.10
description: An MCR-3 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin (colistin) resistance gene variant identified from Aeromonas, Proteus and Escherichia coli.

name: MCR-3.5
description: An MCR-3 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin (colistin) resistance gene variant identified from an extensively-resistant Escherichia coli clinical isolate.

name: MCR-1.10
description: An MCR-1 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin (colistin) resistance gene variant identified from an Escherichia porcine isolate in Great Britain.

name: MCR-1.9
description: An MCR-1 phosphoethanolamine transferase and polymyxin resistance gene variant identified from an enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli clinical isolate.

name: MCR-3.9
description: An MCR-3 polymyxin (incl. colistin) resistance gene variant isolated from an Aeromonas isolate

name: MCR-3.8
description: An MCR-3 polymyxin (incl. colistin) resistance gene variant identified from an Aeromonas isolate

name: MCR-3.7
description: An MCR polymyxin (colistin) resistance gene variant identified in Aeromonas

name: MCR-3.2
description: An MCR-3 polymyxin resistance gene variant identified in a colistin-resistant Salmonella isolate from Canada, located on an IncHI-2 plasmid

name: MCR-1.6
description: An MCR-1 polymyxin resistance gene variant identified from colistin-resistant Salmonella enterica (serovar typhimurium) isolate, carried by an IncP plasmid.

name: MCR-1.3
description: An MCR-1 polymyxin resistance gene variant identified from a poultry Raoultella planticola isolate

name: MCR-1.4
description: An MCR-1 polymyxin resistance gene variant identified from a colistin-resistant Escherichia coli isolate.

name: MCR-8.1
description: A novel phosphoethanolamine transferase and mobile colistin resistance gene identified from carbapenem-resistant NDM-1-producing Klebsiella pneumoniae.

name: MCR-7.1
description: A novel plasmid-mediated colistin-resistant phosphoethanolamine transferase identified from a poultry isolate of Klebsiella pneumoniae

name: MIC sign
description: MIC sign (>, <, =) of the MIC value
Greater than MIC value.
Less than MIC value.
Equal to MIC value.

name: MIC range
description: MIC is a range of two MIC values (e.g., given 10 clinical isolates with a resistance determinant, there are 5 that have an MIC of 25ug/mL and 5 that have an MIC of 100ug/mL agaisnt tobramycin)

name: strain type
description: Strain type used for antibiotic susceptibility testing.

name: resistance determinant in strain
description: Resistant determinant is identified in strain without any experimental methods.

name: deletion of resistance determinant
description: Experimental deletion of resistance determinant in the chromosome of the strain initially with this resistance determinant.

name: deletion of resistance determinant with plasmid harbouring resistance determinant
description: Experimental protocol where there is a deletion of resistance determinant and the transformation of a plasmid harbouring resistance determinant into the same strain.

name: plasmid harbouring resistance determinant
description: Experimental procedure where plasmid harbouring a resistance determinant is transformed into a strain.

name: resistance determinant not in strain
description: Without any experimental protocol, the resistance determinant is absent from the strain.

name: insertion of resistance determinant
description: Experimental insertion of resistance determinant in the chromosome of the strain initially without this resistance determinant.

name: strain
description: Specific strain of bacteria that was used to perform the antibiotic susceptibility test.

name: strain source
description: Source of the strain used in the antibiotic susceptibility test (e.g., clinical, environmental, agriculture)

name: clinical source
description: Strain isolated in a clinical setting (e.g., from a patient)

name: environmental source
description: Strain collected from environment (e.g., soil, water)

name: agricultural source
description: Strain collected from agricultural setting (e.g., chicken, pig)

name: antimicrobial susceptibility test control
description: The control of the antibiotic susceptibility testing, whether there was an experimental control (same strain, with and without resistance determinant) or if there was a group of clinical isolates found to have a resistance determinant compared against a strain without that resistance determinant.

name: experimental control
description: Antimicrobial susceptibility testing was performed on the same strain with and without a resistance determinant.

name: correlative control
description: Antibiotic susceptibility testing is performed on a group of clinical isolates with a resistance determinant compared to different strains that do not have this resistance determinant. No experiment was performed to delete / insert the resistance determinant to determine antibiotic susceptibility using the same genetic background.

name: mphH
description: A chromosomal macrolide 2'-phosphotransferase and resistance gene identified from a Brachybacterium faecium cave isolate

name: experimental source
description: Source is an experimental, commonly used lab strain (e.g., P. aeruginosa PAO1).

name: mphK
description: A chromosomal macrolide phosphotransferase identified from Bacillus subtilis

name: mphN
description: A macrolide phosphotransferase identified on a plasmid in Exiguobacterium

name: mphO
description: A chromosomal macrolide phosphostransferase identified in Brachybacterium paraconglomeratum

name: mphJ
description: A chromosomal macrolide phosphotransferase identified in Brevibacillus brevis VM4.

description: ADC beta-lactamase enzymes with demonstrable carbapenemase activity, an exception amongst these enzymes.

name: dfrB7

name: CAM beta-lactamase
description: CAM (Central Alberta Metallo) beta-lactamases are class B metallo-beta-lactamases and carbapenemases found to confer resistance to broad spectrum antibiotics in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

name: CAM-1
description: CAM-1 is a CAM (Central Alberta Metallo) beta-lactamase and carbapenemase identified from 4 clinical isolates of Pseudomonas aeruginosa from a Canadian hospital

name: murG transferase

description: Mutations in murG which confer resistance to vancomycin in Clostridioides difficile

name: Clostridioides difficile gyrB conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
description: Point mutations in gyrB of Clostridioides difficile conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics

name: Clostridioides difficile rpoB with mutation conferring resistance to rifampicin
description: Point mutations in the rpoB region of Clostridioides difficilewhich confer resistance to rifampin and rifampicin antibiotics

name: beta-lactam potentiator
description: Beta-lactam potentiators are a type of resistance-modifying agent (RMA) which do not impose antibacterial or beta-lactamase inhibitory ability on their own, but improve the performance of antibiotic drugs, specifically beta-lactams.

name: tetracyclic indoline
description: A class of resistance-modifying agents and beta-lactam potentiators which selectively potentiate beta-lactam antibiotics, specifically Amoxicillin-clavulanic acid, in methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) without their own antimicrobial activity.

name: Rifalazil
description: Rifalazil is a rifamycin derivative antibiotic, sometimes used for treating Clostridioides difficile infections.

name: Ramoplanin
description: Ramoplanin is a glycolipodepsipeptide antibiotic derived from gram-positive Actinoplanes used to treat infection with Clostridioides difficile

name: dfrA18
description: A trimethoprim-resistant dihydrofolate reductase identified from Vibrio cholerae

name: ICR-Mo
description: A chromosomally-encoded colistin resistance phosphoethanolamine (PEtN) transferase of Moraxella osloensis. ICR-Mo represents the closest known ortholog to the colistin resistance MCR-1 and MCR-2 PEtN transferases

name: PNGM beta-lactamase
description: PNGM is a family of metallo-beta-lactamases first identified from a deep-sea sediment metagenome and shown to reduce antibiotic susceptibility by hydrolysis of penicillins, carbapenems and extended- and broad-spectrum cephalosporins.

name: PNGM-1
description: PNGM-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta-lactamase first identified from a deep-sea sediment meta-genome. PNGM-1 is shown to reduce susceptibility to extended- and broad-spectrum cephalosporins, carbapenems, and penicillins. PNGM-1 is a novel metallo-beta-lactamase which predates the current antibiotic era.

name: Staphylococcys aureus LmrS
description: MFS transporters are secondary active transporters with single-polypeptide chains containing 400-600 amino acids that transport small solutes across the membrane by using electrochemical gradients. LmrS has 14 transmembrane helices and, when expressed in E. coli, is capable of extruding a variety of antibiotics inclinding linezolid, trimethoprim, florfenicol, chlorampheniocol, erythromycin, streptomycin, kanamycin, and fusidic acid

name: Acinetobacter baumannii AbaF
description: Expression of abaF in E. coli resulted in increased resistance to fosfomycin.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii AbaQ
description: AbaQ is an MFS transporter mainly involved in the extrusion of quinolone-type drugs in A. baumannii

name: S-adenosylmethionine (SAM) superfamily
description: Members of the radical SAM superfamily are involved in a wide variety of reactions, including unusual methylations, isomerization, sulfur insertion, ring formation, anaerobic oxidation, and protein radical formation.

name: tet(61)
description: A tetracycline-resistance ribosomal protection protein

name: Acinetobacter baumannii AmvA
description: AmvA has 14 alpha-helical transmembrane segments, qualifying it as a member of the DHA2 transporter family of the major facilitator superfamily (MFS). When AmvA was expressed in E. coli,  the cells had at least four-fold decreased susceptibility to erythromycin, acridine orange, acriflavine, deoxycholate and methyl viologen. AmvA from the AC0037 strain of A. baumannii was tested.

name: Acinetobacter baumannii AbuO
description: AbuO is akin to the TolC outer membrane efflux protein. Deletion in A. baumannii results in increased susceptibility to antibiotics including amikacin, carbenicillin, ceftriaxone, meropenem, streptomycin, and tigecycline as well as disinfectants benzyalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine [PMID25512405].

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae KpnE
description: KpnE subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime, ceftriaxon, colistin, erythromycin, rifampin, tetracycline, and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate, deoxycholate, dyes, benzalkonium chloride, chlorhexidine, and triclosan

name: tet(48)
description: A tetracycline-resistant ribosomal protection protein. A flavoenzyme capable of degrading tetracycline antibiotics.

name: tet(49)
description: A tetracycline-resistant ribosomal protection protein. A flavoenzyme capable of degrading tetracycline antibiotics.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae KpnF
description: KpnF subunit of KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. Mutation in KpnEF resulted in increased susceptibility to cefepime, ceftriaxon, colistin, erythromycin, rifampin, tetracycline, and streptomycin as well as enhanced sensitivity toward sodium dodecyl sulfate, deoxycholate, dyes, benzalkonium chloride, chlorhexidine, and triclosan.

description: KpnEF resembles EbrAB from E. coli. description: A tetracycline-resistant ribosomal protection protein. A flavoenzyme capable of degrading tetracycline antibiotics.

name: Klebsiella pneumoniae KpnH
description: KpnH consists of ~511 residues, resembles EmrB of E. coli, and is probably a translocase in the KpnGH-TolC efflux protein in K. pneumoniae. Disruption of the pump components KpnG-KpnH signficantly decrease resistance to azithromycin, ceftazidime, ciprofloxacin, ertapenem, erythromycin, gentamicin, imipenem, ticarcillin, norfloxacin, polymyxin-B, piperacillin, spectinomycin, tobramycin, and streptomycin.

Had low or no resistance at all to hydrophobic ones such as nalidixic acid, oxolinic acid, and sparfloxacin in S. aureus and Escherichia coli.

name: Vanillobiocin
description: Antibiotic similar to clorobiocin, but with vanillic acid as the acyl component instead of crenelated 4-hydroxybenzoic acid.

name: Isovanillobiocin
description: Antibiotic similar to clorobiocin, but with vanillic acid as the acyl component instead of crenelated 4-hydroxybenzoic acid. different from vanillobiocin by the [psition of the pyrrole unit attached to the sugar moiety of the antibiotic

name: Declovanillobiocin
description: Antibiotic similar to clorobiocin, but with vanillic acid as the acyl component instead of crenelated 4-hydroxybenzoic acid. Declovanillobiocin lacks the chlorine atom at the aminocoumarin ring compared to vanillobiocin.

name: Tet(X3)
description: A tetracyline resistance gene located on an approximately 300-kb plasmid, designated p47AB. It inactivates all tetracyclines, including tigecycline, eravacycline, and omadacycline.Adjacent to insertion sequence ISVsa3 on the conjugative plasmid.

name: Tet(X4)
description: A tetracyline resistance gene located on an approximately 180-kb plasmid, designated p47EC. It inactivates all tetracyclines, including tigecycline, eravacycline, and omadacycline.Adjacent to insertion sequence ISVsa3 on the conjugative plasmid.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis rpsA mutations conferring resistance to Pyrazinamide
description: RpsA, the 30S ribosomal protein S1 of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, is involved in trans-translation and is targeted by pyrazinonic acid, the active form of the antibiotic pyrazinamide, which disrupts the initiation of mRNA translation. Mutations in the amino acid sequence of rpsA can confer resistance to pyrazinamide maintaining rpsA function.

name: pyrazinamide resistant rpsA
description: The 30S ribosomal protein S1 of Mycobacterium tuberculosis is required for mRNA translation initiation, playing a particular role in trans-translation. Mutations to rpsA prevent pyrazinoic acid, the active form of pyrazinamide catalyzed by pncA, from targeting RpsA to inhibit translation.

name: gradient plate method
description: A method to determine microbial susceptibility to antibiotics in which test bacteria is inoculated onto an agar plate that contains a concentration gradient of antibiotic. The minimum inhibitory concentration of antibiotic is assessed.

name: ceftolozane-tazobactam
description: An antibiotic cocktail containing the cephalosporin antibiotic ceftolozane and the beta-lactamase inhibitor tazobactam

name: vancomycin-resistant beta prime subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoC)
description: Point mutations in rpoC, an RNA polymerase subunit, which confer resistance to vancomycin

name: cefpirome
description: Cefpirome is a fourth generation cephalosporin with activity against methicillin-susceptible Staphylococcus aureus, coagulase-negative staphylococci and viridans group streptococci, and in vitro activity towards Streptococcus pneumoniae.

name: cefsulodin
description: Cefsulodin is a third generation cephalosporin with with activity against Pseudomonas spp., but little activity against other Gram-negative  bacteria.

name: carumonam
description: Carumonam is a monobactam antibiotic. It has activity towards Gram-negative bacteria with negligible activity towards Gram-postitive bacteria.

name: LYS228
description: A monobactam with potent activity against Enterobacteriaceae. Stable to metallo-B-lactamases and serine carbapenemases resulting in potency against the majority of extended-spectrum B-lactamase-producing and carbapenem-resistant Enterobacteriaceae strains tested.

name: tva(A)
description: A pleuromutilin resistance gene encoding a predicted ABC-F transporter. The presence of inhibitory or sub-inhibitory concentrations of tiamulin showed that tva(A) confers reduced pleuromutilin susceptibility that does not lead to clinical resistance but facilitates the development of higher-level resistance via mutations in genes encoding ribosome-associated functions.

name: Zabofloxacin
description: A fluoroquinolone with potent activity against Gram-positive pathogens. Showed the most potent in vitro and in vivo activities against drug-resistant Streptococcus pneumoniae. One of the most potent antibacterial agent against penicillin-resistant S. pneumoniae in a murine systemic infection model.

name: Finefloxacin
description: An 8-cyano-substituted fluoroquinolone with increased antibacterial activity in acidic conditions in contrast to other fluoroquinolones which demonstrate reduced activity in lower pH. Finefloxacin showed increased bactericidal activity at pH 5 in comparison to pH 7 and ciprofloxacin at pH 5 in vitro.

name: Nemonoxacin
description: A C-8-methoxy non-fluorinated quinolone exhibiting potent antibacterial activities against Gram-positive, including MRSA and fluoroquinolone-resistant MRSA, Gram-negative, and atypical pathogens, especially methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus.

name: skin disease
description: An integumentary system disease that is located in the skin.

name: lung disease
description: A lower respiratory tract disease in which the function of the lungs is adversely affected by narrowing or blockage of the airways resulting in poor air flow, a loss of elasticity in the lungs that produces a decrease in the total volume of air that the lungs are able to hold, and clotting, scarring, or inflammation of the blood vessels that affect the ability of the lungs to take up oxygen and to release carbon dioxide.

name: microbial susceptibility test
description: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound

name: disk-diffusion method
description: A method to determine microbial susceptibility to antibiotics wherein bacteria are inoculated onto agar plates and the antimicrobial agent diffused onto the agar plate from a filter paper disk. An approximate, but not exact, MIC is determined by the diameter of growth inhibition zones. This method has been found to have good correlation between in-vivo data and in-vitro data.

name: antimicrobial gradient method (E-test)
description: A method to determine microbial susceptibility to antibiotics in which a plastic strip impregnated with the antibiotic of interest is placed on an agar plate that has been inoculated with bacteria. The antibiotic diffuses from the strip producing a concentration gradient of drug on the agar. The point at which the elliptical shaped area of growth inhibition meets the strip is the minimum inhibitory concentration of the drug of interest.

name: macro broth dilution method
description: A method to determine the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of antibiotics in which growth media is pipetted into a multi-well plate. Each well contains a known concentration of drug which is inoculated with a known quantity of bacteria. The plate is incubated for a specified period of time and each well is assessed for bacterial cell growth. The drug concentration in the first well showing no growth is known as the MIC for that antibiotic. Minimum 2 mL total broth dilution volume.
